snippet.title: Deutsche Bank, JPMorgan launch Aussie bond for US telco giant
snippet.content:
A $US200 billion telecommunications giant is in front of Australian bond investors. Investment banks JPMorgan and Deutsche Bank launched a new "benchmark" Australian dollar debt raising for Verizon Communications on Thursday morning, after earlier arranging meetings with potential investors. The brokers told clients that Verizon was seeking a four-tranche deal including 5 1/2 year floating rate note, 5 1/2 year fixed rate, 7 1/2 year fixed rate and 10 year fixed rate tranches. The brokers opened the books on Thursday morning and said the offer would price on Friday, if not before.
The benchmark kangaroo bond deal is expected to see Verizon raise at least $500 million.
Initial pricing guidance was for 130 basis points to 190 basis points above benchmark rates, depending on the tranche. The brokers told clients the notes were expected to be investment grade and rated Baa1 by Moody's, BBB+ by Standard & Poor's and A- with Fitch.
